items.title: Nintendo’s secret to becoming a design powerhouse? Developers who have stayed at the company for decades
items.description: “The people who first made Nintendo’s hits are still working at the company,” says Keza MacDonald, author of a forthcoming book about the company.

items.title: Airbus warns A320 fleet needs software fix after incident
items.description: A recent incident involving a Jetblue plane revealed “intense solar radiation” could risk corrupting data critical to maintaining working flight contr...

items.title: Ford workers told their CEO ‘none of the young people want to work here.’ So Jim Farley took a page out of the founder’s playbook
items.description: Ford founder Henry Ford decided in 1914 to more than double factory workers' wages to $5 a day, jump-starting the American middle class.

items.title: Steve Jobs taught Gap’s former CEO that micromanaging can be a good thing
items.description: “I’m proud to be a micromanager for what a customer sees, feels, and hears,” Mickey Drexler said.

items.title: India growth beats all estimates as factories defy Trump tariffs
items.description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi called the GDP number "very encouraging."
